Fedor Romashov | Generated by AI

Home 2025.09

Fedor Romashov, known by his online handle “Ormlis,” is a highly accomplished competitive programmer from Russia, recognized as one of the top talents in the global competitive programming community. Born around 2005 in Barnaul, Russia, Romashov has achieved remarkable success in international and national programming competitions, earning accolades for his problem-solving skills, algorithmic expertise, and consistent performance in high-stakes contests. Currently a student at the Higher School of Economics (HSE) in Moscow, he is pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Applied Mathematics and Information Science, a program that aligns closely with his competitive programming pursuits. As of early 2025, Romashov holds the prestigious rank of Legendary Grandmaster on Codeforces, with a maximum rating of 3410, placing him among the elite in the competitive programming world.

Early Life and Introduction to Competitive Programming

Romashov’s journey in competitive programming began during his school years, where he quickly demonstrated exceptional talent in algorithmic problem-solving. His early exposure to programming competitions came through school-level contests, which paved the way for his participation in prestigious international events. By the time he was in high school, Romashov was already competing at an advanced level, representing Russia in global tournaments. Notably, he participated in the International Olympiad in Informatics (IOI), one of the most respected competitions for high school students, where he showcased his ability to tackle complex computational problems.

His early achievements include winning the Romanian Master of Informatics (RMI) in 2021 as an 11th-grade student, a competition that featured 60 teams from 12 countries. This victory highlighted his ability to excel in team-based programming challenges, solving six complex tasks over two rounds. Romashov’s success at such a young age marked him as a prodigy in the field, capable of competing against older and more experienced programmers.

Academic Background

Romashov enrolled at the HSE Faculty of Computer Science in Moscow, where he is currently a third-year student in the Bachelor’s program in Applied Mathematics and Information Science. This program, known for its rigorous curriculum in mathematics, algorithms, and computer science, has provided Romashov with a strong academic foundation to complement his competitive programming endeavors. At HSE, he has been mentored by notable figures such as Mikhail Gustokashin, Director of the Centre of Student Competitions, who was named Coach of the Year by the Russian Competitive Programming Federation (CPF) in 2024. Romashov’s academic environment has fostered his growth, allowing him to train alongside other top programmers like Alexander Babin and Kirill Kudryashov, with whom he has shared podiums in major competitions.

Major Achievements in Competitive Programming

Romashov’s competitive programming career is distinguished by a series of high-profile victories and consistent excellence across various platforms and tournaments. Below are some of his most notable accomplishments:

  1. Games of the Future (2024):
    • Romashov won first place in the competitive programming discipline at the Games of the Future, held in Kazan, Russia, on February 28–29, 2024. The tournament, which featured 50 participants from 27 countries, required competitors to solve 24 algorithmic problems over two five-hour rounds. Romashov solved 22 problems, earning a prize of $51,000 and a tour to the Baikonur Cosmodrome. His performance was so outstanding that he was named the first candidate to receive the title of Master of Sports of Russia in programming, a groundbreaking recognition in the field.
  2. International Collegiate Programming Contest (ICPC):
    • As part of a team from HSE University, Romashov won the 47th ICPC World Finals in 2023, held in Luxor, Egypt, in April 2024. His team also secured gold medals in the 46th ICPC final, cementing their status as world champions. The ICPC is one of the most prestigious team-based programming competitions globally, and Romashov’s contributions were pivotal to his team’s success.
  3. FonCode 2024:
    • Romashov emerged victorious in the FonCode 2024 Competitive Programming Tournament, organized by the Russian Competitive Programming Federation. After a draw in the main round, he solved an additional problem to defeat Ho Dang Zung in a dramatic duel, securing a prize pool share from 1 million roubles. He was also named the Best Competitive Programmer of 2024 by the CPF, a testament to his dominance in the field.
  4. Codemasters Code Cup (2023):
    • Romashov took first place in the Sports Programming track of the Codemasters Code Cup 2023, an all-Russian programming tournament. Competing against 370 students from 63 cities, he navigated a challenging final round with difficult tasks, outperforming strong competitors from institutions like MIPT and HSE.
  5. Codeforces and Other Platforms:
    • On Codeforces, a leading platform for competitive programming, Romashov has achieved a peak rating of 3410, earning the title of Legendary Grandmaster. His consistent participation in contests, contributions to the community (with 10 blog entries and a +115 contribution score), and high performance have made him a well-respected figure in the Codeforces community. He is also active on other platforms, with a record of five competitions tracked on CLIST as of December 2024.

Programming Style and Approach

Romashov is known for his versatility in programming languages, primarily using C/C++ and Python in competitions. His approach to problem-solving is characterized by deep algorithmic knowledge, quick thinking, and the ability to maintain focus during long, grueling contests. In interviews, he has described the challenges of high-level competitions, noting the need for intense concentration and willpower, especially in events like the Games of the Future, which featured an unusually high number of tasks (12 per round compared to the typical 6–14). Despite facing difficulties with certain problems, Romashov’s ability to solve a majority of tasks under pressure has been a key factor in his success.

Personal Traits and Philosophy

At 19 years old, Romashov is described as pragmatic and goal-oriented. In a profile for the Games of the Future, he stated that he has “no dreams, only goals,” which include securing a high-paying job, earning significant income, and enjoying life. This focus on tangible outcomes reflects his disciplined approach to both programming and life. Outside of programming, Romashov enjoys playing video games like Dota and has a casual interest in other hobbies, though his primary passion remains competitive programming.

Recognition and Impact

Romashov’s achievements have earned him widespread recognition in Russia and beyond. His designation as the first Master of Sports in programming by the Russian Ministry of Sports is a historic milestone, highlighting the growing legitimacy of competitive programming as a sport. His awards from the Competitive Programming Federation, including the Best Competitive Programmer of 2024, underscore his influence in the field. Additionally, his success has brought pride to HSE University, where he and his teammates have elevated the institution’s reputation in global programming circles.

Future Prospects

As a third-year student, Romashov is poised to continue his competitive programming career while transitioning toward professional opportunities. His skills in algorithms, data structures, and problem-solving make him a strong candidate for roles at top tech companies, many of which actively recruit competitive programmers for their ability to tackle complex technical challenges. Given his stated goals of financial success and career achievement, Romashov is likely to pursue opportunities in software engineering, research, or related fields after completing his degree. His ongoing participation in competitions, such as the ICPC and Codeforces contests, suggests he will remain a dominant force in the competitive programming community for years to come.

Conclusion

Fedor Romashov is a standout figure in competitive programming, with an impressive track record that includes world championships, national titles, and a top-tier rating on Codeforces. His journey from a schoolboy prodigy to a Legendary Grandmaster and Master of Sports candidate reflects his dedication, talent, and strategic approach to the sport. As he continues to compete and pursue his academic and professional goals, Romashov is set to leave a lasting legacy in the world of competitive programming, inspiring future generations of coders to push the boundaries of algorithmic excellence.
